data.title: Adapted to dpkg's "--instdir"-like options.
data.body:
It's calculating effective root-path of the installation. It may not be equal to "/", if it's used options like "--instdir" of dpkg.
For example, this may be useful if it is used a lot of versions of openra on debian.

data.title: Helicopters being built should not wait for the pad to be empty, to appear
data.body:
In C&C, when you build a helicopter, the unit won't show up until the helipad they are being build at is free of a helicopter landed at it. They will stay in the queue until the helicopter on the pad leaves. They should instead simply appear and move to the rally point, regardless of who is on the pad. 

In C&C, there is no need to have "one helicopter per helipad" like there is in RA, because units reload in the air (but sometimes return to the helipad for repairs).
In C&C Classic, this behavior is also undesired. In C&C 95, when you buy helicopters they are supposed to fly in from the side of the map. (We will simply make them pop up at the pad and move to the rally point).

data.title: FireDelay should do range check before firing (and be abortable)
data.body:
When a unit has FireDelay, it can shoot outside its range after the delay has passed.
So, if a unit leaves range of a weapon, it will still be shot at as though it were in range. An extreme example is the Obelisk, which has a FireDelay of 90:
http://i.imgur.com/LMaeHvg.jpg

Long after the tank has left range, the Obelisk still fires its laser. There should probably be range checking before firing.

With that said, the FireDelay on some units are small: 2 for submarines, 8 for flamethrowers, 15 for grenadiers. Perhaps if Firedelay is < 5 then the range checking can be ignored.

Also: when a unit has been ordered to fire, but is in the FireDelay phase, the firing cannot be aborted by pressing 'S'. Right now, the Obelisk cannot be stopped from firing while charging up, which takes 3 seconds.

milestone.title: release-20131223
milestone.description: The next stable release should not have obvious glitches or horrible crasher bugs left.

data.body: This was added for classic mods. It will sadly break horribly in network games. Don't know yet why.

data.title: Per-cell damage should not apply to empty ___ building footprint
data.body:
I blow up a nuke equal distance from a Barracks and Hand of Nod:
http://i.imgur.com/xZ68s0N.jpg

The Hand of Nod takes more damage, I think because it's taller.
I thought it had to do with the fact that the Hand of Nod had more empty footprint in structures.yaml, but making the building 2x2 instead of 2x3 didn't seem to help. 

Does the per-cell damage algorithm only look at the cells the building art occupies?
In that case, perhaps the cells which have empty ___ in their footprint should have those cells excluded from the damage calculation. 

<bountysource-plugin>

---

Want to back this issue? **[Place a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/115367-per-cell-damage-should-not-apply-to-empty-___-building-footprint?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.body: Fixes #2664 which crashes the game if gap generators are on low power.

data.title: GiveMcvCrateAction: should be enabled even with 0 shares.
data.body:
I want to have an MCV never show up in a crate--unless you have no base.

I tried 

```
    GiveMcvCrateAction:
        SelectionShares: 0
        NoBaseSelectionShares: 9001
        Unit: mcv
```

But unfortunately, it seems that when the selection shares are set to 0, then the NoBaseSelectionShares is not computed. This is important for cnc, where new construction yards should really not show up, but you still want them to show up when the player has no base. 

Also, 
It seems that NoBaseSelectionShares also does not work if the MCV does not have you as an "owner" in vehicles.yaml.

data.title: CNC - Remove multiple queues for Construction Yard
data.body:
The common view is that having multiple production queues for the construction yard is too good, as it basically allows basewalking galore (you can have 5 towers & barracks lined up for deposit in enemy's base).

So, how to allow only one queue for this menu? I tried borrowing the code from RA's .yaml files, using the ClassicProductionQueue function, but I got errors. 

I would like to replace the construction yard queues with a speed-inrease mechanism instead.

data.title: Include #values pulled from SharedRandom in syncreport
data.body: Rather than just the hash, record the number of values that have been used. This should clarify misunderstandings about what that hash value is actually measuring.

data.title: Renderer refactoring - Palettes
data.body:
These patches clean up the renderer (mainly relating to palettes) to provide a useable base for implementing voxel units.

Key changes:
- Palette ownership has been moved from ModData to WorldRenderer.
- A PaletteReference type has been introduced to replace the strings/ints that were previously passed around the engine.
- System palettes to be ignored by palette modifiers are handled at runtime, removing the need for hardcoded lists.
- Cleaner color picker palette modification.
- Cleaner palette initialization.
- Removed a bunch of explicit and implicit dependencies on RenderSimple (palette lookups).
- Removed duplicated World/Chrome shaders (this was dumb).

Other Side effects:
- Referencing undefined palettes fails early, at the point of definition instead of deep in the renderer.
- Parachutes now work correctly with turreted units.
- Rally points / GpsDots / Repair indicators now work correctly with actors that don't use the default player palette.
- Minor perf improvements by caching trait and palette lookups (below the noise level, but visible when comparing screenshots of the perf graph).

data.title: Fix PROC BuildTime bug.
data.body:
Removes offending code that caused game to crash.

I forked this branch from my /bleed, so if you want to check over the commits from other files I've changed, please go ahead.

data.title: CNC broken -- multiplayer game crashes when you build PROC
data.body:
When a player starts building a refinery, the multiplayer game crashes.
Crash occurs in "stable" version 2012.1019, and unstable playtest 2013.0128.

I tried playing the previous stable, 2012.0630, and had no problem there.

Am running Windows 7. Other computer was running latest Ubuntu when testing 0128. 

Another player (cornimac) claimed he had played multiple games before, without crashing. Can't confirm.

This has been added to the PROC after 0630:

```
CustomBuildTimeValue:
    Value: 80
```

data.title: sequences: allow stride per facing and actual length per facing to be different.
data.body: Allows things like using the first 3 frames of each facing when the stride is actually 6.

data.title: ABomb too powerfull
data.body:
Idk why the Abomb got modified, but it definitely isnt helping the game.

There was a reason why the Abomb was limited -> for not being able to take out the Construction Yard with one hit! This kinda noob-like strategy isnt helping anyone here... really unRAalistic to see 5 big buildings being razed with one noob-hit.

data.title: Exception of type `System.InvalidOperationException`: Out of sync in frame 10297: Blame Tick.
data.body:
Another out of sync crash. 3 players, 2x Windows 7 + 1x Linux. This happens quite frequently when playing, it seems that the more players the more likely the game is to crash. It happens mostly in mid-late game, never in the beginning. All running the latest release: 20121019.

Player 1 (Linux):
Exception Log: http://pastebin.com/JNGQTCHe
Syncreport: http://pastebin.com/f8jd63KA

Player 2:
Syncreport: http://pastebin.com/DpDs3b12

Player 3:
Syncreport: http://pastebin.com/msucaxfN

data.title: troll control
data.body:
F3 - pause the game needs some limitation. e.g. just 10 times useable per player. And the question is, whether specs need "pause the game" option....

Rejon on kick needs delay. 3 secs should be enough to start a game before the kicked rejoins.

In general it would be nice to have a little more control as admin. e.g. temporary ip ban?!

data.title: Beginning of a Red Alert classic mod
data.body: Part of the series to bring the changes from https://github.com/Iran/ClassicRA back to OpenRA. Changes to the engine are done in separate pull requests.

data.title: Beginning of a Tiberian Dawn classic mod
data.body: Comes with classic maps, game rules and the first single-player missions as well as a reskinned UI by Harrison.

data.title: Replay viewer: Fog-of-war option
data.body:
Fog-of-war enabled in the replay viewer would make it easier to track units and their viewing range. A player/team-based point of view during games would also be very advantageous.

Being able to see the whole map lit up can be disorienting, especially on large-scale maps.
